</div><div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section" id="section_4"><span id="Evaluate_Variable_Expressions_with_Integers"></span><h2 class="lt-math-15120" id="Evaluate_Variable_Expressions_with_Integers-15120">Evaluate Variable Expressions with Integers</h2>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Remember that to evaluate an expression means to substitute a number for the variable in the expression. Now we can use negative numbers as well as positive numbers.</p>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B25.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B25.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{25}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">When \(n=−5\), evaluate:</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(n+1\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(−n+1\).</li>
</ol>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{n+ 1} \\ {\text{Substitute }{ \color{red}{-5}}\text{ for } n} &{\color{red}{-5}}+1 \\ {\text{Simplify.}} &{-4} \end{array}\]</li>
    <li>\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{n+ 1} \\ {\text{Substitute }{ \color{red}{-5}}\text{ for } n} &{- {\color{red}{(-5)}} +1} \\ {\text{Simplify.}} &{5+1} \\{\text{Add.}} &{6} \end{array}\]</li>
</ol>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B26.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B26.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{26}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">When \(n=−8\), evaluate:</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(n+2\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(−n+2\).</li>
</ol>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(-6\)</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(10\)</li>
    </ol>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B27.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B27.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{27}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">When \(y=−9\), evaluate:</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(y+8\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(−y+8\).</li>
</ol>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(-1\)</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(17\)</li>
    </ol>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B28.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B28.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{28}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate \((x+y)^{2}\) when \(x = -18\) and \(y = 24\).</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{(x+y)^{2}} \\ {\text{Substitute }-18\text{ for }x \text{ and } 24 \text{ for } y} &{(-18 + 24)^{2}} \\ {\text{Add inside parentheses}} &{(6)^{2}} \\{\text{Simplify.}} &{36} \end{array}\]</p>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B29.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B29.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{29}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate \((x+y)^{2}\) when \(x = -15\) and \(y = 29\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(196\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B30.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B30.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{30}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate \((x+y)^{3}\) when \(x = -8\) and \(y = 10\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(8\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B31.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B31.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{31}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate \(20 -z \) when</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(z = 12\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(z = -12\)</li>
</ol>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{20 - z} \\ {\text{Substitute }12\text{ for }z.} &{20 - 12} \\ {\text{Subtract}} &{8} \end{array}\]</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{20 - z} \\ {\text{Substitute }-12\text{ for }z.} &{20 - (-12)} \\ {\text{Subtract}} &{32} \end{array}\]</li>
</ol>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B32.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B32.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{32}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate \(17 - k\) when</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(k = 19\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(k = -19\)</li>
</ol>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(-2\)</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(36\)</li>
    </ol>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B33.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B33.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{33}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate \(-5 - b\) when</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(b = 14\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\(b = -14\)</li>
</ol>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(-19\)</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(9\)</li>
    </ol>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B34.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B34.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{34}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate:</p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\(2x^{2} + 3x + 8\) when \(x = 4\).</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Substitute \(4\) for \(x\). Use parentheses to show multiplication.</p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{2x^{2} + 3x + 8} \\ {\text{Substitute }} &{2(4)^{2} + 3(4) + 8} \\ {\text{Evaluate exponents.}} &{2(16) + 3(4) + 8} \\ {\text{Multiply.}} &{32 + 12 + 8} \\{\text{Add.}} &{52} \end{array}\]</p>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B35.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B35.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{35}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate:</p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\(3x^{2} - 2x + 6\) when \(x =-3\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(39\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B36.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B36.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{36}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Evaluate:</p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\(4x^{2} - x - 5\) when \(x = -2\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(13\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

</div><div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section" id="section_5"><span id="Translate_Phrases_to_Expressions_with_Integers"></span><h2 class="lt-math-15120" id="Translate_Phrases_to_Expressions_with_Integers-15120">Translate Phrases to Expressions with Integers</h2>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Our earlier work translating English to algebra also applies to phrases that include both positive and negative numbers.</p>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B37.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B37.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{37}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate and simplify: the sum of \(8\) and \(−12\), increased by \(3\).</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{\text{the } \textbf{sum} \text{of 8 and -12, increased by 3}} \\ {\text{Translate.}} &{[8 + (-12)] + 3} \\ {\text{Simplify. Be careful not to confuse the}} &{(-4) + 3} \\{\text{brackets with an absolute value sign.}} \\{\text{Add.}} &{-1} \end{array}\]</p>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B38.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B38.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{38}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate and simplify: the sum of \(9\) and \(−16\), increased by \(4\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\((9 + (-16)) + 4 - 3\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B39.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B39.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{39}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate and simplify: the sum of \(-8\) and \(−12\), increased by \(7\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\((-8 + (-12)) + 7 - 13\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<p class="lt-math-15120">When we first introduced the operation symbols, we saw that the expression may be read in several ways. They are listed in the chart below.</p>

<table class="mt-responsive-table" data-label="data-label" summary="This table has two cells. In the top cell is the expression: a, minus b. In the bottom cell are the phrases: “a minus b”, “the difference of a and b”, “b subtracted from a”, and “b less than a”.">
    <thead>
        <tr valign="top">
            <th class="mt-align-center" data-align="center" data-valign="top" scope="col">\(a−b\)</th>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <tr valign="top">
            <td class="mt-align-center    lt-math-15120" data-align="center" data-th="\(a−b\)" data-valign="top">\(a\) minus \(b\)<br />
            the difference of \(a\) and \(b\)<br />
            \(b\) subtracted from \(a\)<br />
            \(b\) less than \(a\)</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
    <caption>Table \(\PageIndex{5}\)</caption>
</table>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Be careful to get <em data-effect="italics">a</em> and <em data-effect="italics">b</em> in the right order!</p>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B40.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B40.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{40}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate and then simplify</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">the difference of \(13\) and \(−21\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">subtract \(24\) from \(−19\).</li>
</ol>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{\text{the } \textbf{difference } \text{of 13 and -21}} \\ {\text{Translate.}} &{13 - (-21)} \\ {\text{Simplify.}} &{34} \end{array}\]</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &\textbf{subtract }24 \textbf{ from }-19 \\ {\text{Translate.}} &{-19 - 24} \\ {\text{Remember, subtract b from a means }a - b} &{} \\{\text{Simplify.}} &{-43} \end{array}\]</li>
</ol>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B41.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B41.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{41}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate and simplify</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">the difference of \(14\) and \(−23\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">subtract \(21\) from \(−17\).</li>
</ol>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(14 - (-23); 37\)</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(-17 - 21; -38\)</li>
    </ol>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B42.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B42.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{42}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate and simplify</p>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">the difference of \(11\) and \(−19\)</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">subtract \(18\) from \(−11\).</li>
</ol>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(11 - (-19); 30\)</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">\(-11 - 18; -29\)</li>
    </ol>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Once again, our prior work translating English to algebra transfers to phrases that include both multiplying and dividing integers. Remember that the key word for <strong>multiplication</strong> is “<strong>product</strong>” and for <strong>division</strong> is “<strong>quotient</strong>.”</p>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B43.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B43.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{43}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate to an algebraic expression and simplify if possible: the product of \(−2\) and \(14\).</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{\text{the product of }-2 \text{ and } 14} \\ {\text{Translate.}} &{(-2)(14)} \\{\text{Simplify.}} &{-28} \end{array}\]</p>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B44.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B44.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{44}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate to an algebraic expression and simplify if possible: the product of \(−5\) and \(12\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(-5(12); -60\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B45.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B45.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{45}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate to an algebraic expression and simplify if possible: the product of \(8\) and \(-13\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(-8(13); -104\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B46.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B46.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{46}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate to an algebraic expression and simplify if possible: the quotient of \(−56\) and \(−7\).</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<p class="lt-math-15120">\[\begin{array} {ll} {} &{\text{the quotient of }-56 \text{ and } -7} \\ {\text{Translate.}} &{-56\div(-7)} \\{\text{Simplify.}} &{8} \end{array}\]</p>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B47.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B47.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{47}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate to an algebraic expression and simplify if possible: the quotient of \(−63\) and \(−9\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(-63\div (-9); 7\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B48.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B48.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{48}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Translate to an algebraic expression and simplify if possible: the quotient of \(−72\) and \(−9\).</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">\(-72\div (-9); 8\)</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

</div><div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section" id="section_6"><span id="Use_Integers_in_Applications"></span><h2 class="lt-math-15120" id="Use_Integers_in_Applications-15120">Use Integers in Applications</h2>

<p class="lt-math-15120">We’ll outline a plan to solve applications. It’s hard to find something if we don’t know what we’re looking for or what to call it! So when we solve an application, we first need to determine what the problem is asking us to find. Then we’ll write a phrase that gives the information to find it. We’ll translate the phrase into an expression and then simplify the expression to get the answer. Finally, we summarize the answer in a sentence to make sure it makes sense.</p>

<p class="lt-math-15120"><strong>How to Apply a Strategy to Solve Applications with Integers</strong></p>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B49.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B49.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{49}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">The temperature in Urbana, Illinois one morning was \(11\) degrees. By mid-afternoon, the temperature had dropped to \(−9\) degrees. What was the difference of the morning and afternoon temperatures?</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<table class="mt-responsive-table">
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 1</strong>. Read the problem. Make sure all the words and ideas are understood.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 2</strong>. Identify what we are asked to find.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">the difference of the morning and afternoon temperatures</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 3</strong>. Write a phrase that gives the information to find it.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">the difference of \(11\) and \(-9\)</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 4.</strong> Translate the phrase to an expression.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">\(11 - (-9)\)</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 5</strong>. Simplify the expression.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">\(20\)</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 6</strong>. Write a complete sentence that answers the question.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">The difference in temperatures was 20 degrees.</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B50.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B50.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{50}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">The temperature in Anchorage, Alaska one morning was \(15\) degrees. By mid-afternoon the temperature had dropped to \(30\) degrees below zero. What was the difference in the morning and afternoon temperatures?</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">The difference in temperatures was \(45\) degrees.</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B51.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B51.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{51}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">The temperature in Denver was \(−6\) degrees at lunchtime. By sunset the temperature had dropped to \(−15\) degrees. What was the difference in the lunchtime and sunset temperatures?</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">The difference in temperatures was \(9\) degrees.</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-objectives">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="APPLY_A_STRATEGY_TO_SOLVE_APPLICATIONS_WITH_INTEGERS."></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="APPLY_A_STRATEGY_TO_SOLVE_APPLICATIONS_WITH_INTEGERS.-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">APPLY A STRATEGY TO SOLVE APPLICATIONS WITH INTEGERS.</span></h5>

<ol>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">Read the problem. Make sure all the words and ideas are understood</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">Identify what we are asked to find.</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">Write a phrase that gives the information to find it.</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">Translate the phrase to an expression.</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">Simplify the expression.</li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120">Answer the question with a complete sentence.</li>
</ol>
</div></div>

<div class="box-example">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B52.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Example_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B52.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Example \(\PageIndex{52}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">The Mustangs football team received three penalties in the third quarter. Each penalty gave them a loss of fifteen yards. What is the number of yards lost?</p>

<p><strong>Solution</strong></p>

<table class="mt-responsive-table">
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 1</strong>. Read the problem. Make sure all the words and ideas are understood.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 2</strong>. Identify what we are asked to find.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">the number of yards lost</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 3</strong>. Write a phrase that gives the information to find it.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">three times a \(15\)-yard penalty</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 4.</strong> Translate the phrase to an expression.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">\(3(-15)\)</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 5</strong>. Simplify the expression.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">\(-45\)</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120"><strong>Step 6</strong>. Write a complete sentence that answers the question.</td>
            <td class="mt-noheading   lt-math-15120">The team lost \(45\) yards.</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B53.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B53.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{53}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">The Bears played poorly and had seven penalties in the game. Each penalty resulted in a loss of \(15\) yards. What is the number of yards lost due to penalties?</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">The Bears lost \(105\) yards.</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

<div class="box-exercise">
<div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section"><span id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B54.7D.5C)"></span><h5 class="box-legend lt-math-15120" id="Try_It_.5C(.5CPageIndex.7B54.7D.5C)-15120"><span class="lt-icon-default">Try It \(\PageIndex{54}\)</span></h5>

<p class="lt-math-15120">Bill uses the ATM on campus because it is convenient. However, each time he uses it he is charged a $2 fee. Last month he used the ATM eight times. How much was his total fee for using the ATM?</p>

<dl>
    <dt><strong class="emphasis bold">Answer</strong></dt>
    <dd>
    <p class="lt-math-15120">A $16 fee was deducted from his checking account.</p>
    </dd>
</dl>
</div></div>

</div><div mt-section-origin="Bookshelves/Algebra/Elementary_Algebra_1e_(OpenStax)/01:_Foundations/1.05:_Multiply_and_Divide_Integers" class="mt-section" id="section_7"><span id="Key_Concepts"></span><h2 class="lt-math-15120" id="Key_Concepts-15120">Key Concepts</h2>

<ul data-bullet-style="bullet">
    <li class="lt-math-15120"><strong>Multiplication and Division of Two Signed Numbers</strong>

    <ul data-bullet-style="open-circle">
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Same signs—Product is positive</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Different signs—Product is negative</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
    <li class="lt-math-15120"><strong>Strategy for Applications</strong>
    <ol>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Identify what you are asked to find.</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Write a phrase that gives the information to find it.</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Translate the phrase to an expression.</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Simplify the expression.</li>
        <li class="lt-math-15120">Answer the question with a complete sentence.</li>
    </ol>
    </li>
</ul>
</div></div>
